H0.text: To streamline birds for efficient flight is the function of hollow bones in birds.

H1.text: To reduce the weight of birds for flight is the function of hollow bones in birds.

H2.text: To store oxygen for highâ€‘altitude flight, the hollow bones in birds serve this function.

H3.text: To make bones strong enough for flight is the function of hollow bones in birds.

A4.text: Birds have many bones that are hollow (pneumatized) with criss-crossing struts or trusses for structural strength.

A5.text: It is extremely lightweight but strong enough to withstand the stresses of taking off, flying, and landing.

A6.text: The bird skeleton is hollow to reduce weight.
